channel.title: For Current Employees on Princeton COS Undergraduate Course Assistants Program
channel.description: Recent content in For Current Employees on Princeton COS Undergraduate Course Assistants Program

item.title: Before Getting Paid...
item.description: Overview # Before getting paid by the Department of Computer Science, you need to be registered in two different places: You need to be registered with the Student Employment Office to be added to university payroll: They will check your eligibility to work, and collect the necessary tax forms. This is a necessary step for any job on campus, but must only be done once during your time at Princeton.

item.title: How to Declare Your Hours
item.description: Princeton University uses JobX to advertise and solicit applications for most student employment jobs on campus (recruiting both undergraduate and graduate students). These jobs are typically hourly jobs, and student employees declare their hours on TimesheetX. Below is information on how to use the latter to declare your hours for COS jobs. For most UCA jobs, the Department of Computer Science does its hiring through TigerUHR. However some jobs, in particular summer research internships, are advertised through JobX.

item.title: The UCA Slack
item.description: The Slack is where certain jobs coordinate.
